title: Strengthening Patient Care Practical Competencies: Reinforcement Learning-Based Nonlinear MIMO System Control Design

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary control theory, linear algebra, Python programming, and fundamental neural network concepts
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically model the dynamic characteristics of nonlinear MIMO systems.
Learners can apply reinforcement learning-based control algorithms (Actor-Critic) to system design.
Learners can generate optimal control inputs for MIMO systems with disturbances using an NN Approximator.
Learners can analyze the convergence of control systems based on Lyapunov stability theory.
Learners can solve practical control problems by conducting team-based projects in mobile environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
